definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: That was transported by and dropped from an iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 系由冰山搬运而来并从中坠下的。

sentences.english: The ice broke into many smaller icebergs after falling into Tasman Lake.
sentences.chinese: 冰川碎成许多小的冰山滑落到塔斯曼湖。

sentences.english: Think of the word you see on the page as only the tip of an iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 想想看，您在页面上看到的一个单词只是冰山一角。

sentences.english: The atomic icebreaker reeved the icebergs.
sentences.chinese: 原子破冰船穿过冰山之间向前航行。

sentences.english: 33Drops of water fall from a melting iceberg near Nuuk, Greenland, on July 26, 2011.
sentences.chinese: 格陵兰努克附近，从融化的冰山上流下的水滴。

sentences.english: Detailed view of an iceberg calved from glaciers on west Greenlandic coast.
sentences.chinese: 格陵兰西海岸冰川上脱落冰山的清晰图像。

sentences.english: And yet I have told thee but a tithe of what was there.
sentences.chinese: 但我说的这一切，都不过是冰山一角。

sentences.english: An enormous iceberg nestles into an ice shelf in Antarctica.
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的冰山依偎在南极冰架的怀抱。

sentences.english: In exhibition industry, Hanwei may be just the tip of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 展览行业中，汉威也许只是冰山的一角。

sentences.english: Some icebergs, however, drift north to warmer climates and disintegrate.
sentences.chinese: 不过，也有一些冰山会往北漂流到温带然后消融。

sentences.english: Researchers call it the glacial buzz-saw.
sentences.chinese: 研究人员称之为为“冰山锯”。

sentences.english: Warm winters, however, may allow iceberg calving and high flow rates to continue.
sentences.chinese: 但是暖冬则会让冰山的高崩离率以及高流速保持不变。

sentences.english: The girl from Iceland is indeed as cold as an iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 从冰岛上女孩果然冷得像冰山一样。

sentences.english: The ship struck an iceberg, which tore a huge hole in her side.
sentences.chinese: 船碰在一座冰山上，船帮被撞出一个大洞。

sentences.english: The unusual tides caused glaciers to calve icebergs off Greenland.
sentences.chinese: 这种不寻常的潮汐使得格陵兰的冰川崩裂成冰山。

sentences.english: It is impossible to put into words the feeling of my first sighting of an iceberg on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 无法形容第一次在海平线上看到冰山的感受。

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
